ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
This course changed my soul. 

The "close readings" of Aristotle and Socrates paired with modern psych-philosophy writings was an incredible cocktail of intellectual and emotional potency.

This course helped me understand the world differently. I am very fortunate to have been in this class.
Endless amounts of knowledge. Philosophy, psychology, how they come together, how to teach and talk about them.
We evaluated ancient ideas and how they manifested in modern texts and ideas.
Ancient philosophy, psychology, and a million other things about the way our minds and environments interact.
This course taught me how to read psychology papers, be confident on camera speaking about my ideas, and understand cognitive science in its true interdisciplinary sense.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths:
Dean Gendler is the most amazing instructor I've had in my 55 trips around the sun. 

Weakness:  We only had class one day a week.
The course was both broad and deep and at times one took away from the other. But even so it was incredible to be able to talk intensely about so many different readings.
It was good that it was so small but I dont think there needed to be a pre req for having read the Republic in a course before.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
100%

I want to replicate this course with people from my former military life.  I believe it would be amazingly valuable.
This was by far my favorite course at Yale. Yes.
Life changing. Validated my major; changed the way I saw the world. Truly one of those classes that makes Yale Yale.
